intro: Hypolepis sikkimensis, commonly known as the Sikkim water fern, is a species of fern native to the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Davalliaceae and is characterized by its delicate, floating fronds that are often found in freshwater habitats. The plant has a rhizomatous growth habit and produces sporangia on the undersides of its leaves. Its leaves are pinnately divided and can be up to 30 cm in length, making it a striking ornamental plant. Hypolepis sikkimensis is adapted to moist, shaded environments and is often found in mountain streams and wetlands.
